oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A ceremony performed with the Brachycerus (African Ground Weevil) in order to preserve young babies from convulsions. In the Katkop dialect by Dia!kwain (L V.-23. 5833-5840) The Brachycerus used to cure illness in little children. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-21. 7822-7825). The !nu !nurussi (or Brachycerus, or African ground weevil) eats the child's illness. 1) |han=kass'o heard this from his mother (|xabbi-an) and observed it himself, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-21.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Brachycerus used as a means of cure for little children; the same insect not used again when another child is ill
